Title: Senior Data Analyst
JD:
About the job
    


          Who we are looking for

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join the Product and Merchandise Data Foundation. This role participates as a member of a product team; delivering scalable data architecture and data products to drive decision making across Nike’s Global functions. The candidate needs to be a strong analyst, meticulous teammate, and a self-motivated data evangelist.
You are unconventionally curious, especially about how data can be used to optimize business opportunitiesLead multi-functional Kaizen teams across different shifts in improving their operation using our NLS guiding principles & culture, including various LEAN tools, techniques, and continuous improvement philosophyLead the introduction, application, and alignment to data governance concepts and behaviors across APLA’s data and analytics solutions, ensuring we are meeting business needs while balancing quality, risk and costApply expertise with business partners to collaborate with key partners to understand requirements, drive knowledge into action and support data driven decision makingYou thrive in an adventurous environment, and you are excited by the challenge of building something from the ground upYou ask questions, continually learn, and find opportunities to share your knowledge with others Who you will work with

You will work in a product squad model led by a Product Manager and consisting of data analysts, engineers and developers.

You will work as part of the Data Products and Reporting leadership team consisting of Product Directors and Data Analytics Directors while partnering closely with Data Engineering and Enterprise Platform leadership. You will collaborate across our broader organization with business teams as well as other data, analytics and technology functions at Nike.

What you bring
Bachelor’s Degree or a combination of relevant education, experience, and trainingMinimum of 5+ years of consistent track record in product management;Excellent problem-solving and interpersonal communication skillsConfirmed ability to deliver on commitmentsComfortable working in a fast-paced, results-oriented environmentBusiness process competence and ability to map processes to data models and architecturesRelevant experience in data warehousing, dimensional modeling and the ability to bring standard methodologies with regard to data management, ETL, API integrations, and data governanceProficiency in SQL (Hive, Impala) or similar experience in analyzing large structured and unstructured datasetsExperience analyzing large structured and unstructured datasetsDemonstrable ability to develop structured analysis that support data architecture designExperience defining data architectures to support data visualization tools such as Tableau, IBM Cognos, and PowerBIExperience defining data architectures to support semantic data layers, such as SSAS Cubes/Tabular and Cognos PackagesSolid grasp of various database management systems like Oracle, MySQL, Teradata, Netezza, SQL Server, or DB2Working understanding of Agile methodologies and principles such as Scrum, LEAN, Kanban, and XP Programming, and how they’re applied in workplace cultureExperience with cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and AWSExperience with cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, and AWS. Experience with Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, HBase, Spark, Impala, Cassandra, Storm, Flume, Pig, or Hive

Title: SAP Senior Data Analyst- Vendor
JD:
About the job
    


          As a SAP Master Data analyst, you will work with all SEC capabilities and other functional / Business teams to develop, test and deploy Vendor Master data solution and integrate it with new technology within Nike in an omnichannel environment. As we support the organization initiative to strengthen our Consumer Direct offense and Digital transformation, you will take all possible steps to contribute and support all Capability functions in terms of Master data that will lead to the success of our organization. Your primary goal will be to perform below function in Data analyst role in vendor Master space for all activities which is the sub function of Master data Capability.

What you will work on:
As part of SAP Vendor team, you will implement requirements gathering, design, support development, functional unit testing that includes back end SAP configuration and testing of software productsWork alongside SAP engineering, SAP architect, QA and Release teams for all project implementation requirementsPerform FIT -GAP on all SAP Vendor master design requirements, perform design, define and maintain data model and definition around attributes in scopeUnderstand Nike standard for all master data needs, work with multi-functional teams perform activities needed to secure sensitive Vendor master dataWork with SAP security and CIS teams to setup all access needed for the team to perform project and production support functionsConnect with business teams to capture input needed to cater respective business needsCoordinate and work with regional teams (GC, EMEA, NA and APLA) where ever need to complete SEC activitiesWork with partner teams – SAP, ACN and other contract resources to fulfill the needs of vendor master data need for businessProvide inputs as needed for feasibility of architecture designs, tools and conceptsImplement Adhoc changes to SAP vendor master data as requested by business to help run the enterprise optimallyBuild and change requirement document, functional design document, configuration document, source to target mapping, data model, process flow diagram, data definition document, test plan, test scenarios needed for implementationFunctional testing, bug fixing and support all mock work needed for implementationImplement cutover and data conversion activities for vendor master needs for mock and launchPerform production support activities through incident and problem management processLearn, understand and perform all project activities through SAFe methodology

What we are looking for:
Bachelor's degree in IT, Vendor Management, or combination of relevant education, experience, and trainingMinimum 8+ years of experience in SAP Master Data, primarily in Vendor master subject areaDomain and business process knowledge in SAP AFS or SAP Retail is requiredSAP S/4 & SAP MDG implementation knowledge preferredHands on experience in the implementation of SAP vendor master not limited to SAP configuration in SAP AFS or SAP Retail areaSAP Vendor Master configuration knowledge in SAP Materials Management is required, programming knowledge (ABAP) is an added advantageHands on experience in using testing and Agile tools for projectsExperience working on large-scale global projectsExperience working with virtual teams and multi-functional partners

Title: SAP Senior Data Analyst - Material
JD:
About the job
    


          As a SAP Senior Material Master Data Analyst, you will work with all SEC capabilities and other functional / Business teams to design, develop, test and deploy Material Master data solution and integrate it with new technology within Nike in an omnichannel environment. As we support the organization initiative to strengthen our Consumer Direct offense and Digital transformation, you will take all possible steps to contribute and support all Capability functions in terms of Master data that will lead to the success of our organization. Your primary goal will be to perform below function in Sr Product manager role in Material Master space for all activities which is the sub function of Master data Capability.

What You Will Work On
 As part of SAP MM team, you will implement requirements gathering, design, support development, functional unit testing that includes back-end SAP configuration and testing of software products Work alongside SAP engineering, SAP architect, QA and Release teams for all project implementation requirements Perform FIT -GAP on all SAP material master design requirements, perform design, define and maintain data model and definition around attributes in scope Understand Nike standard for all master data needs, work with multi-functional teams perform activities needed to secure sensitive material master data Work with SAP security and CIS teams to setup all access needed for the team to perform project and production support functions Connect with business teams to capture input needed to cater respective business needs Coordinate and work with Enterprise and Regional biz teams (GC, EMEA, NA and APLA) on whatever needed to complete SEC activities Work with partner vendor teams – SAP, ACN and other contract resources to fulfill the needs of material master data need for business Provide inputs as needed for feasibility of architecture designs, tools and concepts Implement Adhoc changes to SAP material master data as requested by business to help own the enterprise optimally Build and change requirement document, functional design document, configuration document, source to target mapping, data model, process flow diagram, data definition document, test plan, test scenarios needed for implementation Functional testing, bug fixing and support all mock work needed for implementation Execute cutover and data conversion activities for material master needs for mock and go-live Perform production support activities through incident and problem management process Learn, understand and perform all project activities through SAFe methodology Generate report needed to analyze the performance of system with regard to material master

What We Are Looking For
 Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Information Security/Assurance, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field of study, or any combination of relevant equivalent experience, education and training Minimum 5+ years of experience in SAP Master Data, primarily in Materials Management subject area Domain and business process knowledge in SAP AFS or SAP Retail is required SAP S/4 & SAP MDG implementation knowledge is an added advantage Hands on experience in the implementation of SAP Material master not limited to SAP configuration in SAP AFS or SAP Retail area SAP Material Master configuration knowledge in Materials Management is required, programming knowledge (ABAP)is an added advantage Demonstrable experience in using testing and Agile tools for projects Experience working on large-scale global projects Experience working with virtual teams and multi-functional partners Experience working with offshore / near shore team

PREFERRED:

8 years of experience in SAP Master Data, primarily in Materials Management subject area
